statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Fairfield 79, Niagara 75
article.story: NIAGARA, N.Y. -- Sean Crawford scored 19 points, including all of Fairfield's final five points in the game's last 1:14, as the Stags edged Niagara 79-75 on Friday night in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference opener for both teams. Fairfield, which led for nearly the entire game, had just a 60-58 advantage with 7 1/2 minutes left to play. But Maurice Barrow's free throw started an 11-1 Lancers run that put the game out of reach, setting up Crawford's clutch free-throw shooting late. Rakim Sanders, who came in leading the team in scoring with 18.1 per game, scored 16 points and pulled down 12 rebounds for the Stags. Ryan Olander added 15 points and Derek Needham 12 for Longwood, which snapped a two-game skid and has now won five straight against Niagara. Juan'ya Green scored a game-high 35 points, including 5 of 8 on 3-pointers, to lead the Purple Eagles (3-4).
